Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Parecoxib as an Analgesic Adjuvant in Brachial Plexus Nerve Block

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 150 patients scheduled for elective forearm surgery were recruited from January 2009 to November 2010.

Participants.evidence: 150 patients scheduled for elective forearm surgery were recruited from January 2009 to November 2010.

Intervention.evidence: Group A (n=50) received ropivacaine 0.25% alone, Group B (n=50) received ropivacaine with 20 mg parecoxib locally, and Group C (n=50) received 20 mg parecoxib intravenously.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effect of parecoxib, a COX-2 antagonist, on sensory and motor block times when added to ropivacaine in brachial plexus nerve blocks.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the duration of sensory and motor blocks, measured over 24 hours postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 150 patients scheduled for elective forearm surgery were recruited from January 2009 to November 2010.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Group A (n=50) received ropivacaine 0.25% alone, Group B (n=50) received ropivacaine with 20 mg parecoxib locally, and Group C (n=50) received 20 mg parecoxib intravenously.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Group B showed prolonged motor and sensory block times compared to Group A (mean difference = X hours, 95% CI Y to Z; p < 0.05).
